article_title: Oceanside High School damaged by vandalism — Midcoast — Bangor Daily News — BDN Maine
article_text:
ROCKLAND, Maine — Police say they have suspects in vandalism that occurred at Oceanside High School East.

The vandalism was reported shortly after 8 a.m. Saturday, according to Rockland Deputy Police Chief Wally Tower. He said there was forced entry into the building sometime between Friday evening and Saturday when the damage was discovered.

Several fire extinguishers were used to spray the inside of the school and the vandals caused other unspecified damage as well. Numerous personal items also were taken from throughout the school, he said.

article_summary:
ROCKLAND, Maine — Police say they have suspects in vandalism that occurred at Oceanside High School East.
Several fire extinguishers were used to spray the inside of the school and the vandals caused other unspecified damage as well.
The vandalism was reported shortly after 8 a.m. Saturday, according to Rockland Deputy Police Chief Wally Tower.
Numerous personal items also were taken from throughout the school, he said.
He said there was forced entry into the building sometime between Friday evening and Saturday when the damage was discovered.
